ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: Suite C, Lancaster House, Grange Business Park, Enderby Road, Whetstone

TITLE.P: Stonewater-Heating contracts in the South West and West regions

SHORT_DESCR.P: The contract will be for the provision of a 24 hour, 365 days a year cover for all non-electrical heating systems (domestic and commercial), including emergency and out of hours. The contract will also allow the client the option to include other planned and reactive works, etc. subject to the performance of the appointed service provider. Please see the procurement documentation for the full scope of service for this contract.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: Stonewater has issued a separate Notice to procure the repairs, in the South West region. Lot 1 of that Notice has the option to include all heating services. Therefore Stonewater Limited will either award Lot 1 of the separate Notice and not award Lot 3 of this Notice or 2 Service Providers by awarding Lot 2 of the separate Notice and Lot 3 of this Notice.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The contract will be for the provision of a 24 hour, 365 days a year cover for all servicing and breakdown works for heating systems (domestic and commercial), including emergency and out of hours. This will include renewable technologies but excludes any electrically heated homes. The contract will also allow the client the option to include other planned and reactive works, such as mechanical and electrical servicing / maintenance, compliance services, etc. subject to the performance of the appointed service provider. Please see the procurement documentation for the full scope of service for this contract.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: It is intended that the contract will commence in April 2019 and, subject to annual reviews, will run for a period of 5 years with the option for renewal, as decided by Stonewater Limited, for an extension of up to a further 10 years (on a 5 years + 5 years basis.) The maximum duration of the contract is therefore 15 years.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: Stonewater Limited wishes to ensure that only suitably qualified and experienced organisations are considered for this contract. Therefore, the SQ stage will include an evaluation of Candidates’ responses to technical questions on their previous experience and capability. Only the highest scoring Candidates will be shortlisted and Invited to Submit an Initial Tender.

INFO_ADD.P: Over the duration of the contract, Stonewater Limited reserves the right to enter into an alternative agreement with the appointed service provider, to deliver the works through an Alternative Delivery Model (ADM). Please see the procurement documentation for further information.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The contract will be for the provision of a 24 hour, 365 days a year cover for all servicing and breakdown works for heating systems (domestic and commercial), including emergency and out of hours. This will include renewable technologies but excludes any electrically heated homes. The contract will also allow the client the option to include other planned and reactive works, such as mechanical and electrical servicing / maintenance, compliance services, etc. subject to the performance of the appointed service provider. SUITABILITY.P: Please refer to the SQ and initial tender documentation for all relevant information on requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: Please refer to the SQ and initial tender documentation for all relevant information on the contract performance conditions.

INFO_ADD.P: The Contracting Authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are Small or Medium Enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.

The Contracting Authority reserves the right to cancel the procurement at any time and not to proceed with the award of any contract at any stage of the procurement process or to award only a part of parts of any contract. In any event, the Contracting Authority may not award Lot 3.
Economic Operators are to note that the provisions of the Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations 2006 (as amended) may apply.
For more information about this opportunity, please visit the Delta eSourcing portal at:
To respond to this opportunity, please click here:

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: The Contracting Authority shall comply with the requirements of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 when notifying Economic Operators of the outcome of this procurement.
